title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context'
body:
I tried this code: ```rust RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build --verbose ``` I expected to see this happen: successful build Instead, this happened: the compiler unexpectedly panicked ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.44.0-nightly (b2e36e6c2 2020-04-22) binary: rustc commit-hash: b2e36e6c2d229126b59e892c9147fbb68115d292 commit-date: 2020-04-22 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.44.0-nightly LLVM version: 9.0 ```
Backtrace

``` RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo build --verbose Fresh unicode-xid v0.1.0 Fresh version_check v0.1.5 Fresh matches v0.1.8 Fresh smallvec v1.4.0 Fresh yansi v0.4.0 Fresh cfg-if v0.1.10 Fresh cc v1.0.52 Fresh percent-encoding v1.0.1 Fresh safemem v0.3.3 Fresh version_check v0.9.1 Fresh yansi v0.5.0 Fresh autocfg v1.0.0 Fresh untrusted v0.6.2 Fresh traitobject v0.1.0 Fresh language-tags v0.2.2 Fresh typeable v0.1.2 Fresh state v0.4.1 Fresh glob v0.3.0 Fresh unicode-bidi v0.3.4 Fresh unicode-normalization v0.1.12 Fresh proc-macro2 v0.4.30 Fresh libc v0.2.69 Fresh byteorder v1.3.4 Fresh log v0.4.8 Fresh idna v0.1.5 Fresh bitflags v1.2.1 Fresh httparse v1.3.4 Fresh memchr v2.3.3 Fresh quote v0.6.13 Fresh serde v1.0.106 Fresh base64 v0.9.3 Fresh time v0.1.43 Fresh unicase v1.4.2 Fresh num_cpus v1.13.0 Fresh atty v0.2.14 Fresh base64 v0.10.1 Fresh log v0.3.9 Fresh url v1.7.2 Fresh ring v0.13.5 Fresh indexmap v1.3.2 Fresh syn v0.15.44 Fresh toml v0.4.10 Fresh mime v0.2.6 Fresh cookie v0.11.2 Fresh devise_core v0.2.0 Fresh pear_codegen v0.1.2 Fresh hyper v0.10.16 Fresh devise_codegen v0.2.0 Fresh pear v0.1.2 Fresh devise v0.2.0 Fresh rocket_http v0.4.4 Fresh rocket_codegen v0.4.4 Fresh rocket v0.4.4 Compiling hello-rocket v0.1.0 (/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket) Running `rustc --crate-name hello_rocket --edition=2018 src/main.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -Cbitcode-in-rlib=no -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=97a8c3b53fc8a0ca -C extra-filename=-97a8c3b53fc8a0ca --out-dir /Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/deps --extern rocket=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/deps/librocket-3dfb676548af36ea.rlib -L native=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/build/ring-60a62680e2aaa5b3/out` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context', src/librustc_middle/ty/query/on_disk_cache.rs:456:17 stack backtrace: error: could not compile `hello-rocket`. Caused by: process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name hello_rocket --edition=2018 src/main.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,link -Cbitcode-in-rlib=no -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=97a8c3b53fc8a0ca -C extra-filename=-97a8c3b53fc8a0ca --out-dir /Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/deps -C incremental=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/incremental -L dependency=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/deps --extern rocket=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/deps/librocket-3dfb676548af36ea.rlib -L native=/Users/vasilipascal/work/rust/rocket/hello-rocket/target/debug/build/ring-60a62680e2aaa5b3/out` (signal: 11, SIGSEGV: invalid memory reference) ```
